message:
Correctness_Score: 0.2
Style_Score: 0.2
Simplicity_Score: 1.0
Robustness_Score: 0.1
Reasoning: The solution is functionally incorrect because it ignores the A array and decides solely by parity of N; many inputs (for example N=4, A=[2,1,1,1]) admit optimal play where the parity-only rule fails. The code has no comments or explanation and uses very terse variable names, so style and documentation are poor. The implementation is extremely concise and performs only the necessary I/O and a single check, so it scores highly for simplicity. It is not robust or maintainable: it fails to handle the actual game logic, ignores edge cases tied to A values, and would fail many valid test cases.
